publicationStmt.ab: Drafting working materials by Institute for the Study of the Ancient World. Not ready for publication.

sourceDesc.bibl: R.S. Bagnall, R. Casagrande-Kim, A. Ersoy, C. Tanriver and B. Yolaçan, Graffiti from the Basilica in the Agora of Smyrna (New York 2016), T9.6..

msIdentifier.geogName: Basilica of the Agora of Smyrna

supportDesc.support: at right edge of bay, to the right of the upper tabula ansata (T9.3). area 22 cm wide × 15 cm high. Block letters 3–4 cm high.

div.ab:
[μῆ]λ[ον] ἡδ[ονή] λόγο̣ς̣ ὄνομα νή̣σας̣
̣ ̣ ̣
se
e ̣ ̣ ̣ ̣
̣ ̣

for a parallel see T12.1, and see introduction, p. 52. nothing much remains of line 1, but the surface is badly preserved there. we take νήσας to be the aorist participle of νέω. on the right pier (a20), on the west side, facing the bay, at 23 cm from the left edge of the pier. area 25 cm wide × 32 cm high. old roman cursive letters 4–7 cm high. on the right pier (a20), on left bevel surface, at top. area 21 wide × 24 cm high. old roman cursive letters 4–7 cm high.
